ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I would absolutely recommend this course! It is an essential undertaking for students interested in writing about the life of ideas, and the idea of the intellectual.

This is an ideal course for someone who is interested in intellectual history and/or who is interested in intellectual formations in 20th-century U.S. history. I would highly recommend this course to other students because of the carefully constructed syllabus and Professor Agnew's vast knowledge about the topic.
A history of the apparatus around intellectuals in the social and human sciences.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: I had never taken a course on intellectual history so this was a good introduction. It enabled me to develop a project that I foresee myself working on in the future (related to my dissertation).
This course opened me up to different approaches to intellectual history, which is useful for my degree.
